question: The configuration at C-2 and C-3 of the compound given : <image 1>
description:
The image depicts a Newman projection of a molecule viewed along the C-2 to C-3 bond. The carbon atoms (C-2 and C-3) are represented by the intersection point of the lines in the projection. 

At C-2:
- The front carbon (C-2) has three substituents: 
  - A methyl group (CH₃) pointing upwards.
  - A hydrogen atom (H) pointing to the left.
  - A chlorine atom (Cl) pointing downwards.

At C-3:
- The back carbon (C-3) has three substituents:
  - An ethyl group (C₂H₅) pointing downwards.
  - A hydrogen atom (H) pointing to the right.
  - A chlorine atom (Cl) pointing upwards.

The relative positions of these substituents around the C-2 and C-3 carbons are crucial for determining their stereochemical configurations (R or S).
